FuncDef: The display license state command displays the status of a license file in the current system.
Examples: Info: Current license state is Demo. The license for the current configuration will expire in 4 day(s).
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view the status of a running license file in the current system, run the display license state command. The command output includes the current status of the license file and the remaining days for the license file before expiration.
A license file can be in any of the following states:
Demo: The license file is in the demo state.Normal: The license file is in the normal state.Default: The license file is in the default state.Trial: The license file is in the trial state.Emergency: The license file is in the emergency state.
If a license file has been activated and in the keepalive period, the display license state trial command can be run to display the remaining valid keepalive period of the license file.

Prerequisites
An active license file exists on the device.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
